```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

```{.r .cell-code}
library(readxl)

dt <- read_excel("/Users/paritosh/Documents/Code_Submission/UMass/603_Spring_2023/posts/_data/LungCapData.xls")
```
:::


# Q.1)

## A


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
hist(dt$LungCap, freq = FALSE)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Homework_1_Paritosh_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


## B


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dt %>% 
  select(Gender, LungCap) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = Gender, y = LungCap, fill = Gender)) + 
  geom_boxplot() +
  scale_y_continuous(breaks = seq(from = 0, to = 15, by = 0.75))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Homework_1_Paritosh_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


In median,quantiles and other measures males have higher lung capacity

## C


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dt %>% 
  select(LungCap,Smoke) %>% 
  group_by(Smoke) %>% 
  summarise(mean = mean(LungCap))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  Smoke  mean
  <chr> <dbl>
1 no     7.77
2 yes    8.65
```
:::
:::


Smokers have higher lung capacity. Ideally they should be having less as per out premise it does not seem to be the case, May be smoking might not be hurting the lung capacity as it is assumed to be.

## D

-   Age less than or equal to 13


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dt %>% 
  filter(Age <= 13) %>% 
  group_by(Smoke) %>% 
  summarise(LungCap = mean(LungCap))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  Smoke LungCap
  <chr>   <dbl>
1 no       6.36
2 yes      7.20
```
:::
:::


-   Age is equals 14 or 15


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dt %>% 
  filter(Age == 14 | Age == 15) %>% 
  group_by(Smoke) %>% 
  summarise(LungCap = mean(LungCap))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  Smoke LungCap
  <chr>   <dbl>
1 no       9.14
2 yes      8.39
```
:::
:::


-   Age is 16 or 17


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dt %>% 
  filter(Age == 16 | Age == 17) %>% 
  group_by(Smoke) %>% 
  summarise(LungCap = mean(LungCap))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  Smoke LungCap
  <chr>   <dbl>
1 no      10.5 
2 yes      9.38
```
:::
:::


-   Age is greater than or equal to 18


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dt %>% 
  filter(Age >= 18) %>% 
  group_by(Smoke) %>% 
  summarise(LungCap = mean(LungCap))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  Smoke LungCap
  <chr>   <dbl>
1 no       11.1
2 yes      10.5
```
:::
:::


## E

-   After the age of 13 the lung capacity of non smokers is higher than that of smokers.


    ::: {.cell}
    
    ```{.r .cell-code}
    # Creating a tibble
    table <- tibble( x = c(0,1,2,3,4), Frequency = c(128,434,160,64,24))
    n <- 810
    ```
    :::


## Q.2)

## A


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
table %>%
  filter(x == 2) %>%
  pull(Frequency)/n
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.1975309
```
:::
:::


## B


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
table %>%
  filter(x < 2) %>%
  pull(Frequency) %>%
  sum()/n
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.6938272
```
:::
:::


## C


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
table %>%
  filter(x <= 2) %>%
  pull(Frequency) %>%
  sum()/n
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.891358
```
:::
:::


## D


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
table %>%
  filter(x > 2) %>%
  pull(Frequency) %>%
  sum()/n
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 0.108642
```
:::
:::


## E


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
table <- table %>%
  mutate(probability = Frequency / n) 

print(table)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 5 × 3
      x Frequency probability
  <dbl>     <dbl>       <dbl>
1     0       128      0.158 
2     1       434      0.536 
3     2       160      0.198 
4     3        64      0.0790
5     4        24      0.0296
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
sum(table$x * table$probability)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 1.28642
```
:::
:::


## F


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
 var(table$x)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 2.5
```
:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
sd(table$x)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] 1.581139
```
:::
:::
